context: The word 'lehmä' in Finnish means 'cow'. It refers specifically to the female of Bos primigenius taurus. The declension shows different forms depending on grammatical case, such as nominative (lehmä), genitive (lehmän/lehmien), and partitive (lehmää/lehmiä).  The possessive forms indicate ownership ('my cow' - lehmäni, 'your cow' - lehmäsi etc.). It can also refer to any female ruminant, like a doe (hirvi lehmä) but this is less common. The word is often found in compounds.
